text: The 2018 IHF Women's Junior World Championship was the 21st edition of the tournament and took place in Debrecen, Hungary from 1 to 14 July 2018. Hungary won their first ever title by defeating Norway 28–22 in the final. ==Qualification== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Qualification ! Vacancies ! Qualified |- | Host | align="center"|1 | |- | 2016 Women's Youth World Handball Championship | align="center"|1 | |- | 2017 Asian Women's Junior Handball Championship | align="center"|3 | |- | 2017 Women's Under-19 European Handball Championship | align="center"|2 | |- | 2017 African Women's Junior Handball Championship | align="center"|3 | |- | 2018 Pan American Women's Junior Handball Championship | align="center"|3 | |- | European qualification | align="center"|11 | |} ==Venues== Matches will be played in Debrecen. *Főnix Hall (6,500) *Hódos Imre Sports Hall (2,000) ==Draw== The
